content.title: Fawara Sanyantra
content.details: The Fawara Sanyantra under the Agriculture Department of the Rajasthan government will give 70% to 75% subsidy to the farmers for installing sprinkler plants. Through this farmers can irrigate more land by getting sprinkler subsidy. The subsidy given by the state government to the farmers will be sent directly to their bank accounts through DBT. To avail of the benefit of the Rajasthan Fawara Sanyantra Subsidy Yojana, a farmer should have land up to 0.2 hectares. So that the fields can be irrigated by installing sprinkler plants. The income of farmers will improve through this scheme. Apart from this, efficient utilization and production will also increase. Besides, 50% to 55% of water can be saved by irrigating the fields through sprinklers.
benefits: The grant amount is 70% of the unit cost for general farmers.
The grant amount is 75% of the unit cost for small and marginal farmers, Scheduled Caste/Tribe farmers, and women farmers.
The grant is payable up to a maximum area of 5 hectares.
eligibility: The Applicant should be a farmer.
The applicant should be a native of Rajasthan.
The farmer should have at least 0.2 hectares of irrigated agricultural land.
documents_required: Jamabandi copy (not more than 6 months old)

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The government will provide subsidies to farmers to install sprinkler plants. This will save water and farmers will also be able to irrigate their fields through sprinklers.

faqs.question: Fawara Sanyantra Subsidy Yojana has been started in which state?
faqs.answer: Scheme has been launched in the state of Rajasthan.

faqs.question: Who will get the benefit of Rajasthan Fawara Sanyantra Subsidy Yojana?
faqs.answer: All the farmers of the state will get the benefit of Rajasthan Scheme.

faqs.question: How much subsidy will be provided to farmers under the Yojana?
faqs.answer: 70 to 75% subsidy benefit will be provided to the farmers of the state.

faqs.question: What is the official website of Rajasthan Fawara Sanyantra Subsidy Yojana?
faqs.answer: The official website of this Scheme is http://rajkisan.rajasthan.gov.in/.

faqs.question: What is DBT?
faqs.answer: DBT stands for Direct Benefit Transfer. It is a mechanism used by governments to transfer subsidies and welfare payments directly to the bank accounts of beneficiaries.

faqs.question: Under which department does this scheme come?
How can I apply online?
faqs.answer: One can apply by visiting the e-Mitra center. https://sso.rajasthan.gov.in/signin

faqs.question: How do I know if a field in the application form is mandatory?
faqs.answer: Fields marked with an asterisk (*) are mandatory.

faqs.question: Is there any agricultural land criteria?
faqs.answer: The farmer should have at least 0.2 hectare of irrigated agricultural land.

faqs.question: What documents are required?
faqs.answer: 1. Jamabandi copy (not more than 6 months old), 2. Aadhar Card/Jan Aadhar Card 3. Irrigation Source Certificate, 4. Supplier's Quotation.
